contextId.information: "that were shiny like bronze that has been polished." This describes the feet of the creatures. AT: "and they shone like polished bronze" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

Lightning flashes and then disappears quickly, and the creatures moved from one place to another quickly. The abstract noun "appearance" can be translated as a verb. AT: "The living creatures were moving swiftly back and forth, and they looked like lightning" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: The living creatures were moving swiftly back and forth, and they had the appearance of lightning

contextId.information: These sentences are not complete because Ezekiel was showing that he was excited about what he saw. They can be translated as complete sentences: "The wings sounded like ... water. They sounded like ... moved. They sounded like ... rainstorm. They sounded like ... army." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: Like ... waters. Like ... moved. Like ... rainstorm. Like ... army.

contextId.information: This compares how the sword is well polished and how it reflect light to the appearance of lightning. AT: "My sword is polished and flashes like lightning" or "It is polished and reflects light as bring as lightning" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
This means that the sword is so shiny that light reflects off of it easily and brightly. AT: "and light reflects off of it as brightly as lightning" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: so it will be like lightning

contextId.information: This compares the prophets of Israel to lions who attack and kill their victims. AT: "They kill people for they are like roaring lions who attack and kill their prey. They take peoples' precious wealth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: like a roaring lion tearing apart a victim. They consume life and take precious wealth

contextId.information: Here Yahweh uses a simile to describe how Nebuchadnezzar's army will enter into the city of Tyre. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: When he enters your gates, he will enter as men come into a city whose walls have been broken down

contextId.information: Here Tyre is compared to other cities that no longer had people living in them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: When I make you a desolate city, like the other cities that are not inhabited

contextId.information: The sails of the ship are compared to the banners or flags of Tyre. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: Your sails were colored linen from Egypt that were like your banners

contextId.information: Egypt was stronger than other nations, like lions are stronger than other animals. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: like a young lion among the nations

contextId.information: Oil flows slowly and smoothly. AT: "make the rivers run smoothly like oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: make their rivers run like oil

contextId.information: This compares how the people behaved to a woman's unclean menstruation rags. This emphasizes disgusting their behaviors were to Yahweh. AT: "Their ways were as disgusting to me as the unclean menstruation of a woman" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: Their ways were like the unclean menstruation of a woman before me

contextId.information: This simile means the army will be so large that it will cover the entire land. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
